sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"智力，智慧"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: mind, intellect, intelligence, brains, wit, wisdom
means: mind ： 使用广泛，无褒贬之意。强调诸如认识、记忆、思考、决定等的智慧功能。
intellect ： 侧重不受感情或意志左右的冷静思考或领悟能力。
intelligence ： 指处理或对付问题或情况的特殊才智；也指运用、展开智慧的能力。
brain(多用复数brains)强调理解能力和独立的或者首创性的思维能力。
wit ： 指先天的才能、智力、意识等，隐含小聪明意味。
wisdom ： 较文雅，也可指明智的言行。

sentence.Network_en: Holmes was gregarious, a great wit, a man of wide interests.
sentence.Network_cn: 福尔摩斯爱交际，非常风趣，兴趣广泛。

sentence.Network_en: His abrasive wit and caustic comments were an interviewer's nightmare.
sentence.Network_cn: 他睿智刁钻，评论尖刻，对任何采访他的人而言都是梦魇。

sentence.Network_en: The essays could do with a flash of wit or humor.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些散文需要一些出其不意的风趣或幽默。

phrase.cizu_name: have (one's) wits about (one) 或 keep (one's) wits about (one)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wit(t), gewit(t), denoting the mind as the seat of consciousness, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch weet and German Witz, also to wit
Old English witan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch weten and German wissen, from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit veda 'knowledge' and Latin videre 'see'

entry.def: Wit is the ability to use words or ideas in an amusing, clever, and imaginative way.

example.ex: Boulding was known for his biting wit...
example.tran: 博尔丁爱说尖酸的俏皮话是出了名的。

example.ex: They love her practical attitude to life, her zest and wit.
example.tran: 他们喜欢她务实的人生态度、她的热情和幽默。

entry.def: If you describe someone as a wit, you mean that they have the ability to use words or ideas in an amusing, clever, and imaginative way.

example.ex: Holmes was gregarious, a great wit, a man of wide interests.
example.tran: 福尔摩斯爱交际,非常风趣，兴趣广泛。

entry.def: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation.

example.ex: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
example.tran: 资料就摆在那儿，等着有头脑的人去利用。

entry.def: You can refer to your ability to think quickly and cleverly in a difficult situation as your wits .

example.ex: She has used her wits to progress to the position she holds today.
example.tran: 她凭借个人才智升到了今天的职位。

entry.def: You can use wits in expressions such as frighten someone out of their wits and scare the wits out of someone to emphasize that a person or thing worries or frightens someone very much.

example.ex: You scared us out of our wits. We heard you had an accident.
example.tran: 你把我们吓坏了，我们听说你出事了。

example.ex: ...a huge bass drum which frightened the wits out of the organist each time it was banged.
example.tran: 每次敲起来都让风琴师惊慌失措的巨型低音鼓

entry.tran: 时刻保持警惕;随机应变
entry.def: If you have your wits about you or keep your wits about you, you are alert and ready to act in a difficult situation.

example.ex: Travellers need to keep their wits about them.

entry.tran: 智穷才尽;黔驴技穷;无计可施
entry.def: If you say that you are at your wits' end, you are emphasizing that you are so worried and exhausted by problems or difficulties that you do not know what to do next.

example.ex: We row a lot and we never have time on our own. I'm at my wit's end.
example.tran: 我们经常争吵，从无在一起的时间，我真是没有办法了。

entry.def: If you pit your wits against someone, you compete against them in a test of knowledge or intelligence.

example.ex: He has to pit his wits against an adversary who is cool, clever and cunning.
example.tran: 他不得不与一个冷静、聪明而又狡猾的对手斗智。

entry.tran: （用于更准确地描述）亦即，也就是
entry.def: To wit is used to indicate that you are about to state or describe something more precisely.

example.ex: He'd like 'happiness' to be given a new and more scientifically descriptive label, to wit 'Major affective disorder, pleasant type'.
example.tran: 他想给“幸福”一个更为科学的新称谓，准确地说即“愉悦型重度情感障碍”。
